sections.heading: No person or owner of livestock shall allow livestock to run at large in the
sections.text:
State of Illinois. All owners of livestock shall provide the necessary
restraints to prevent such livestock from so running at large and shall be
liable in civil action for all damages occasioned by such animals running
at large; Provided, that no owner or keeper of such animals
shall be liable for damages in any civil suit for injury to the person or
property of another caused by the running at large thereof, without the
knowledge of such owner or keeper, when such owner or keeper can establish
that he used reasonable care in restraining such animals from so running at
large.

sections.heading: A notice of a violation of this Act shall be given to the person
sections.text:
or owner of livestock running at
large if known and a maximum of 24 hours may be granted in which to make
the necessary corrections if the violation is an accidental occurrence and an
investigation reveals no identifiable individual at fault. Any livestock
allowed to run at large may be impounded at a facility capable of
restraining such livestock. A notice of impoundment shall be delivered to
the owner of such livestock in person or by certified mail.

sections.heading: Any person who violates this Act shall be guilty of
sections.text: a Class C misdemeanor, except a 10th or subsequent violation of this Act is a Class 4 felony and the court may order the livestock impounded.

sections.heading: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the "Illinois
sections.text: Domestic Animals Running At Large Act".
